item.title: Lost Paradise: Remembering Aku Aku Polynesian Restaurant in Vintage Las Vegas
item.description:
A Taste of the South Pacific on the Stardust Strip

The 1960s Las Vegas Strip was known for its extravagant spectacle â€“ glittering showrooms, glamorous showgirls, and increasingly elaborate resort themes. But beyond the gaming tables and headliner acts, themed dining experiences became a crucial element of the overall entertainment package. And few were as immersive and memorable as Aku Aku, a Polynesian restaurant that opened within the Stardust Resort & Casino on January 29, 1960. It was a bold departure from the typical Vegas fare and offered a portal to a tropical fantasy unlike anything seen before.
